intro: Indigofera dolichochaete, commonly known as the long-stemmed indigo plant, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit, with slender, wiry stems that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are compound, consisting of multiple small, oval-shaped leaflets. Indigofera dolichochaete is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
